segment.source: WinPE: Boot in UEFI or legacy BIOS mode
segment.target: WinPE: Boot in UEFI or legacy BIOS mode

segment.source: WinPE: Boot in UEFI or legacy BIOS mode
segment.target: WinPE: Boot in UEFI or legacy BIOS mode

segment.source: WinPE: Boot in UEFI or legacy BIOS mode
segment.target: WinPE: Boot in UEFI or legacy BIOS mode

segment.source: When you boot Windows PE on a UEFI PC, you may need to check whether the PC is booted in UEFI mode or legacy BIOS-compatibility mode.
segment.target: When you boot Windows PE on a UEFI PC, you may need to check whether the PC is booted in UEFI mode or legacy BIOS-compatibility mode.

segment.source: For example, running Windows Setup through Windows PE requires you to be in the correct firmware mode.
segment.target: For example, running Windows Setup through Windows PE requires you to be in the correct firmware mode.

segment.source: For many operations, such as applying Windows images using Diskpart and DISM, the firmware mode might not make a difference.
segment.target: For many operations, such as applying Windows images using Diskpart and DISM, the firmware mode might not make a difference.

segment.source: Boot to UEFI mode
segment.target: Boot to UEFI mode

segment.source: When booting the PC, you may need to manually select the UEFI boot files: EFIBOOTBOOTX64.EFI.
segment.target: When booting the PC, you may need to manually select the UEFI boot files: EFIBOOTBOOTX64.EFI.

segment.source: Boot your PC and press the key to get into the firmware menus (examples: Esc, F2, F9, F12).
segment.target: Boot your PC and press the key to get into the firmware menus (examples: Esc, F2, F9, F12).

segment.source: Look for a firmware option to choose the boot file (examples: Boot to file, Boot to EFI file).
segment.target: Look for a firmware option to choose the boot file (examples: Boot to file, Boot to EFI file).

segment.source: Select the file from the USB drive: .
segment.target: Select the file from the USB drive: .

segment.source: Detect whether Windows PE is booted in BIOS or UEFI mode
segment.target: Detect whether Windows PE is booted in BIOS or UEFI mode

segment.source: Check the HKLMSystemCurrentControlSetControlPEFirmwareType registry value to see if the PC is booted to UEFI or BIOS mode.
segment.target: Check the HKLMSystemCurrentControlSetControlPEFirmwareType registry value to see if the PC is booted to UEFI or BIOS mode.

segment.source: Note: you may need to run to make sure this value is present.
segment.target: Note: you may need to run to make sure this value is present.

segment.source: This command returns 0x1 if the PC is booted into BIOS mode, or 0x2 if the PC is booted in UEFI mode.
segment.target: This command returns 0x1 if the PC is booted into BIOS mode, or 0x2 if the PC is booted in UEFI mode.

segment.source: Sample script:
segment.target: Sample script:

segment.source: If this is a frequent problem, you can remove the boot files for UEFI mode or BIOS mode to prevent the PC from booting in the wrong mode.
segment.target: If this is a frequent problem, you can remove the boot files for UEFI mode or BIOS mode to prevent the PC from booting in the wrong mode.

segment.source: If the PC firmware is set up to boot in the wrong mode, the media will immediately fail to boot, allowing you to immediately retry booting the PC into the correct mode.
segment.target: If the PC firmware is set up to boot in the wrong mode, the media will immediately fail to boot, allowing you to immediately retry booting the PC into the correct mode.

segment.source: Boot in UEFI mode: To prevent Windows PE from booting in BIOS mode, remove the bootmgr file on the root of the media.
segment.target: Boot in UEFI mode: To prevent Windows PE from booting in BIOS mode, remove the bootmgr file on the root of the media.

segment.source: Boot in BIOS mode: To prevent Windows PE from booting in UEFI mode, remove the efi folder on the root of the media.
segment.target: Boot in BIOS mode: To prevent Windows PE from booting in UEFI mode, remove the efi folder on the root of the media.
